Package cetus.hir

Class VariableDeclaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Declaration
      • cetus.hir.VariableDeclaration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotatable, Printable, Traversable, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class VariableDeclaration
extends Declaration
    Represents a statement that introduces a new variable or function prototype. A variable declaration is composed of specifiers and declarators. For example, in the declaration unsigned int x, y the specifiers would be unsigned and int while the declarators would be x and y.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class cetus.hir.Declaration

        annotations, children, empty_list, needs_semi_colon, object_print_method, parent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      VariableDeclaration​(Declarator declarator)
      Creates a variable declaration that does not use specifiers, such as for a constructor prototype.
      VariableDeclaration​(Specifier spec, Declarator declarator)
      Creates a variable declaration that has only one specifier, such as for int x.
      VariableDeclaration​(Specifier spec, java.util.List declarator_list)
      Creates a declaration of multiple variables that has only one specifier, such as for int x, y, z.
      VariableDeclaration​(java.util.List specs)
      Creates a parameter declaration for a procedure, where the parameter is unnamed but its type is specified.
      VariableDeclaration​(java.util.List specs, Declarator declarator)
      Creates a variable declaration that has multiple specifiers, such as for unsigned int x.
      VariableDeclaration​(java.util.List specs, java.util.List declarator_list)
      Creates a declaration of multiple variables that has multiple specifiers, such as for unsigned int x, y, z.

    • Method Detail

      • addDeclarator

        public void addDeclarator​(Declarator declarator)
        Adds another declarator to this declaration. For example, if the declaration is int x; and a declarator for y is added, the declaration becomes int x, y;.
        Parameters:
        declarator - The declarator to add.

        public java.util.List<IDExpression> getDeclaredIDs()
        Description copied from class: Declaration
        Returns a list of name ID introduced by this declaration.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getDeclaredSymbols

        public java.util.List<Symbol> getDeclaredSymbols()
        Returns the list of symbols being declared within this variable declaration. Basically, it is equivalent to using getChildren() but asserts the returned list contains symbol type.
        Returns:
        the list of declared symbols.
